Reviews.Title: Where Have You Been?
Reviews.Author: Cyril A Longton
Reviews.Content: Everyone (except for you obviously) has known for YEARS that the Chromebook is an internet-only device. That is its main function. ALL the advertisements have stated in no uncertain terms that it will not run windows-based software, that it will only run internet-based software. Where have you been? Your complaint is like telling someone to not buy a car because it can't fly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: gabby.adams
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer for myself because every laptop I've ever had for some reason the system crashed. I love this because you cant download anything on it, everything goes to you google drive. The only issue I did have was it didn't have microsoft words but it does come with this software for typing papers and you can save in doc. and pdf format so that was a plus. The shipping was awesome it got here in 2 days but I also was using the 2 day shipping trial. I really have nothing bad to say about this computer it does exactly everything I need it to.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for intended purpose
Reviews.Author: David A.
Reviews.Content: It's not intended to be your only, or even main, computer.  It's a secondary or tertiary machine.  But if you want a fast, light, cloud-based laptop with a solid state (flash) drive rather than a HDD, and with a good-sized screen (and even an RJ-45 jack for ethernet cable!), this may be right for you.  Don't plan on using most MicroSoft software; rather, again, this is cloud-based.  But as a back-up unit, used mostly for web-surfing, e-mail, and the like, it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good Second Computer
Reviews.Author: Jazmyne Williamson
Reviews.Content: I would not get this computer if it will be your main computer. The computer is internet based and you cannot do anything without it. If you are in the government this is a complete no go since you cannot access any government sites.
